citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility's current program of veterinary care does not include birds that are kept by the facility. A program of adequate
veterinary care must be established by the facility and approved by the attending veterinarian to ensure: the
appropriateness of the facilities for the species kept, that appropriate methods are employed for the prevention, control,
diagnoses and treatment of disease, and that adequate guidance is provided to personnel involved in the care and use of
animals, among other things outlined in this section of the Act. The absence of a program of adequate veterinary care and
formal veterinary care for birds could lead to poor health and welfare outcomes for this group of animals.
Correct by ensuring that the program of veterinary care includes all regulated animals at the facility, and that the attending
veterinarian is given adequate authority for their care by formal arrangement. Correct by October 31, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have an environmental enhancement plan for birds. An environmental enhancement plan must be
developed, documented, and approved by the attending veterinarian so as to promote the health and psychological well-
being of birds.
Correct by ensuring that a complete, documented plan for environmental enhancement that addresses the required
elements approved by the attending veterinarian is maintained and available for inspection. Correct by October 31, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility's current program of veterinary care does not include birds that are kept by the facility. A program of adequate 
veterinary care must be established by the facility and approved by the attending veterinarian to ensure: the 
appropriateness of the facilities for the species kept, that appropriate methods are employed for the prevention, control, 
diagnoses and treatment of disease, and that adequate guidance is provided to personnel involved in the care and use of 
animals, among other things outlined in this section of the Act. The absence of a program of adequate veterinary care and 
formal veterinary care for birds could lead to poor health and welfare outcomes for this group of animals.  
 
Correct by ensuring that the program of veterinary care includes all regulated animals at the facility, and that the attending 
veterinarian is given adequate authority for their care by formal arrangement. Correct by October 31, 2023. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility does not have an environmental enhancement plan for birds. An environmental enhancement plan must be 
developed, documented, and approved by the attending veterinarian so as to promote the health and psychological well-
being of birds.  
 
Correct by ensuring that a complete, documented plan for environmental enhancement that addresses the required 
elements approved by the attending veterinarian is maintained and available for inspection. Correct by October 31, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
